statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Saint Joseph's 81, Richmond 63
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Pat Calathes scored 22 points, grabbed 10 rebounds and sparked two scoring runs as Saint Joseph's won its fifth straight game, 81-63 over Richmond on Saturday night. Rob Ferguson had 18 points, and Garrett Williamson a career-high 16 for the Hawks (9-4, 2-0 Atlantic 10), whose winning streak is the team's longest since March 2005. Ryan Butler and Dan Geriot each had 15 points for the Spiders (8-7, 1-1), who had their four-game winning streak stopped. Trailing 11-4 six minutes into the game, the Hawks went on a 25-3 run, highlighted by three 3-pointers by Calathes, to take a 29-14 lead. Richmond responded with a 15-7 run, including seven points by David Gonzalvez, and closed within 36-29 at the half. Saint Joseph's started the second half with another outburst, scoring 22 of the next 25 points. Calathes scored 11 in the run and the Hawks led 58-32 with 11:11 left. The Hawks have averaged 80 points during their streak and now hold an 11-2 edge over Richmond in the all-time series.
